segments.text: Ryan, what's wrong?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I just got some bad news.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: My friend, Shotty, passed away.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh, I'm so sorry
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: The end, he's been sick for awhile.  He had cancer.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh, my gosh.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yeah.  It's just, I never thought it would actually happen, you know? I mean- He's such a fighter and he's always so positive about everything.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You know, he was gonna, and we -- all the way up to the end we were just talking about how- you know all the stuff we were gonna do and, you know.  When he finally kicked this stupid cancer, you know, and we were gonna --
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: he wanted to travel, you know.  And he's so talented.  Probably the most talented person I have ever met in my entire life.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What did he do?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: He was a designer, you know.  But he did everything. You know, He painted and he- and he did costume design, he did set design, he did lighting, he was --
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: he just did everything.  He was literally, literally the most talented guy I have ever met in my entire life.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: And he's gone now and I  -- I just can't believe it.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yeah.  I'm so sorry.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I mean, one second you think, you know, you're just having a conversation and then --
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: you know, sometimes you think you want to make that phone call, or you think you want to tell somebody something, or something like that.  Do you know what I mean?  Like that's -- he was the person that I did that with.  You know, like, that's the person who I needed to call to tell things to all the time.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You guys have been-
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: And now I don't have that person anymore, you know.  And it's -- -- it's just, you.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You think that things get easier, you know, as you as you get older and you -
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: and it just gets worse.  It just gets worse, everything is bad all the time; people die, your friends die, family dies, your best friends die. it's-
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I'm sorry. I-
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You always think, you know when you were- you know when you were a little kid and you think something is gonna happen, like, it will all be better when I am older, you know?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: And I don't know why people don't just tell you off the bat that it's just gonna suck anyway.  You know, like, what's the point?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: All the best people die, all the bad people live and they make life shitty for you anyway.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Wow, Ryan I know that you are hurting right now but I don't think you always feel like that.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: No, you're right.  I don't.  You're right.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Even, yeah -- he doesn't he would never feel that way, he would never want me to feel that way.  Of course not, but that's just where I am right now and -- -- I don't know what else to do with it.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yeah. I understand.  I think it's really healthy to grieve.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I just miss him.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: If there's anything I can do to be there for you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Thanks.
segments.speaker: M
